thread.title: U.S., China Announce Cybersecurity Agreement During Xi Jiping’s Visit
thread.title_full: U.S., China Announce Cybersecurity Agreement During Xi Jiping’s Visit

author: King & Spalding
title: U.S., China Announce Cybersecurity Agreement During Xi Jiping’s Visit
text:
U.S., China Announce Cybersecurity Agreement During Xi Jiping’s Visit more+ Contact 
To embed, copy and paste the code into your website or blog: <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=f2baef1b-d1bd-454f-abc3-bbb82de82f2d" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"></iframe> 
C 
Early in the week, President Xi was in Seattle to meet Microsoft cofounder Bill Gates, Apple’s Tim Cook, and Amazon’s Jeff Bezos. In an address given Tuesday, President Xi resisted longstanding accusations that China has sponsored economically- and politically-motivated cyberattacks. “The Chinese government will not in whatever form engage in commercial theft, and hacking against government networks are crimes that must be punished in accordance with the law and relevant international treaties,” 
On Friday, President Xi was in Washington, D.C., where the White House announced the terms of that agreement . Each country has agreed to cooperate (subject to its own laws) with the investigation of cybercrimes, and has promised that it will not “conduct or knowingly support” theft of intellectual property for private gain. The countries also cited multilateral cooperation on setting international relations norms regarding cybersecurity. Perhaps most encouragingly, the parties’ 
China’s involvement in hacking has long been an open secret, with the latest report on the People’s Liberation Army’s infamous Unit 78020 published to coincide with President Xi’s visit. Indeed, reports suggest that the deal on cybersecurity cooperation is the result of earlier threats from the Obama administration to impose sanctions for China’ 
Reporter, Daniel Ray , Silicon Valley, +1 650 422 6715, dray@kslaw.com
